715152f-b.title: Manhattan: 117th Street (East) - Pleasant Avenue
715152f-b.text:
East 117th Street, west from Pleasant Avenue, showing
pavement conditions on the north side of this street.
At the left midground is the institutional building that
houses P. 3. No. 85. This is at the S. W. corner of First
Avenue. View E shows details of the sidewalk at the N.E.
corner at that Avenue. The Second Avenue ''El'' station
appears in the background of both views.
May 4, 1937
No's. 1-2
W. ''. A., photo
Five Boroughs Project
CREDIT LINE IPER..TIVE

722635f-b.title: Manhattan: Pleasant Avenue - 117th Street
722635f-b.text:
(1)
330 Pleasant Ave., east side, between 117th and 118th Streets.
This building is an old house which has been used for a dosen
or more years as a Settlement House (The Neighborhood House),
of the Church Extension Committee of the Presbytery of New York
and is now being given up.
July 1S, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, five years later.
1932.
J. Clarenoe Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 252.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

722636f-a.title: Manhattan: Pleasant Avenue - 117th Street
722636f-a.text:
329 Pleasant Avenue, west side, between 117th and 118th Streets, a
two-story house with a stucco facing.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 254.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
